												Alright! Here we are again, back together reliving memories of the times we were molested at summer camp. Wait. Oh, we're doing a review? Whoops.So, The Darkness II!If you played the first Darkness, you must have been left wanting more. I know I was, especially when Jenny says, "Wake up.", then it cuts the credits. I don't think I've been that anxious since I was waiting on a pregnancy test to show results. The first game was awesome. The elements of free-roam/sandbox the developers so graciously added, the voice acting, the level design and coloring....it was all just so enveloping! I personally really like the No Mans Land levels where you were thrown into the war between the Germans and the British - that was some terrifying♥♥♥♥♥♥ All that to say, The Darkness laid excellent ground work for The Darkness 2 with the story, color schemes and voice acting. Unlike BLOPS 2, TD 2 didn't completely destroy the gameline's reputation. That is to say, unless you're one of those pretentious and picky ♥♥♥♥♥♥s who nitpicks about with the changes in graphics or things like that. The first thing I noticed that I really liked about this game is the slow intro to the main theme of the game. Obviously, it wasn't that slow, since you get ambushed during your dinner with some ladies of the night at some deago food spot within the first 10 or so minutes of the game - BUT - at least the devs eased you into it instead of the begining of TD 1 where your flying through traffic, shooting at people. The steady introduction of the darkness powers and influence was pretty neat, as well. So time moves on and I start noticing things like the full axis control of the demon arms and the RIDICULOUS executions you can do and I start to think, "This reminds me of my last relationship".Then I think, "Wow, this is really well made!" The game, albiet, was shorter than I had hoped for, but still, its the Darkness irregardless. (TBCNT)

content:
Posted: May 18, 2015
												Have you ever wondered what it would be like to be the head of a major crime syndicate whilst simultaneously being possessed by a creature of pure evil? Well then this might be the game for you.This is an awesome first person shooter. The gameplay is top-notch, responsive and heart pounding. Each of the guns that you can acquire really packs a punch and you get to see the joy on your enemies faces as you literally blow them away with furious anger and harsh language. Of course the huge arsenal is not the main attraction of this game. That comes in the form of your two tentacle friends and the terrible powers they grant you. First off the tentacles themselves really pack a punch allowing you to execute some very gruesome and disgusting executions; I think there are at least ten, all of which look really cool… If you happen to be a sadist, which we all are. Then there are the powers, eating hearts to gain health, rapid fire explosive bullets and lobbing black holes just to name a few. You will have a ton of fun tearing your way through the city.The creators were going for an art style that was reminiscent of a graphic novel and they really hit the nail on the head. The game is beautiful in its own dark way. The environments were nothing too special but each one had its own feel and lent to the overall bleak atmosphere. As for the story, it was pretty good, nothing too amazing but it allowed the player to exact bloody vengeance and tug at the heart strings as well.Besides the main single player campaign, which only lasts a few hours, there is also a second game mode that can be undertaken in single or multiplayer. In it you get to play as one of four new characters all with their own dark weapons and powers. It added a lot more longevity to the title and with the unique storyline it is well worth a play. I had a go with all the characters to see which one suited me best before blasting my way through everyone who looked at me funny.This game is awesome and frankly it is very underrated. If you pick this up you will find a very enjoyable and bombastic adventure that will have you want to play through a couple times. Even at full price it’s a good title but on sale you would be mad not to pick it up.Have fun  ^_^

NoteI played through The Darkness 1 a several times back in the day. It felt refreshing and surprisngly awesome, so my review is definitely biased. Also, I played this game with a gamepad. I did not feel like using KB + Mouse.What I expectedI went into this game expecting nothing special after reading some of the reviews. I mainly expected a game with okay gameplay and a forgettable story. What I gotNow I was right about the gameplay, but I soon found myself getting sucked into the story and its characters. I don't know what it was, but I really got enveloped by the game's narrative. The voice acting and writing are definitely above average in my opinion. The few twists in the game actually surprised me, and I loved coming along for the ride. Maybe it's because I played and liked the first game so much, but I found myself empathizing for Jackie. What I thinkI was thoroughly surprised and impressed by this game. It is fantastic, and I'd wholly recommend it to anyone who wants to enjoy a gritty, linear action game with decent gameplay and an above-average narrative. Man, that ending.

												This is one of those games that should be in "Meh" category... It is not bad enough to be "Not Recommended", neither is it good enough to be in the better of the two...Keep in mind, that I did not play the first part, and just read the story on the webz... It might, or might not have influenced my opinion on the game.So, short review... This game is a classic shooter, no-brainer, in which you usually just need to run around and kill large quantities of enemies. Story is short and okayish, and the game would probably be worse if it dragged for more than those couple of hours, and for those who like it, there is New Game +... Gun play is fine, but nothing special, and it bothered me that I usually didn't know what gun I used (it was not really important), as long as I had enough ammunition for any of those...Blood and gore are all around, and if you are not okay with it, don't play this game...Experience system is somewhat important at the beginning, but later on, I just didn't know what perks to buy (they are all nothing special), so finished the game with many unspent points...Graphics is ok, but, as the name of the game suggests, too dark :)Final verdict is "Meh"... It is ok game for a few hours of no-brainer fun, but nothing more than that... On the other hand, I don't like these kind of shooters to much, so it might be only me :)

												Personal Rating: 8 of 10Awesome game! This masterpiece excels in every possible way. Apart from your convention gun blasting FPS, this game allows you to quad wield by adding 2 tendrils that you can use simultaneously with your guns. The gameplay is really refreshing and I typically liked the graphics style that uses cel-shading to give it a 2d-ish comical look.The plot is rather straight forward but the way the story is presented with the incredible in-game voiced dialogue really captivates brings out each character.The game is rather narrative where there are plenty of dialogs, but they are so well done you won't be bored. The level design are rather short although each of them stands out since they tend to have different settings. There are quite a variety of enemies to keep things interesting and I think the length of each level is just nice to keep players from getting bored.The developers also added other game modes that you can play with friends with new characters and skills. I said friends because there are no one online anymore.There are a couple of minor bugs which i encountered such as weapons dropped below ground and prevents you from picking up and the graphics jerk sometimes (during non-combat moment/close up with NPCs). The game also has almost zero replay value. This game had tonnes of potential. After each mission you head back to your mansion. And I think the game can use some upgrades apart from skills where you can manage back in the mansion.Also, I have a 360 controller plugged into my PC. The game detected the controller and every button prompt are for the controller. I cannot find where to disable this so I was having quite a hard time figuring out the keys.Many people are questioning why is there a DLC link in the library page but none was found in store. Unfortunately this game does not get the recognition it deserved. The developers really did a great job with the game but the sales did not hit their expection and further funding was pulled off including planned DLCs.I was really hoping for a sequel of a prequel remake for PC. And this time it should get its well deserved recognition.

This is among those few weirdly perfect games what absolutely lack basicly everything other than it's main feature, but that is so awesome it can carry the entire game (such as Portal or Shadow of Mordor). The Darkness II deserves more fame because it's absolutely fantastic at what it does. Just don't have any other expections.

												Have you ever wondered what it would be like to be the head of a major crime syndicate whilst simultaneously being possessed by a creature of pure evil? Well then this might be the game for you.This is an awesome first person shooter. The gameplay is top-notch, responsive and heart pounding. Each of the guns that you can acquire really packs a punch and you get to see the joy on your enemies faces as you literally blow them away with furious anger and harsh language. Of course the huge arsenal is not the main attraction of this game. That comes in the form of your two tentacle friends and the terrible powers they grant you. First off the tentacles themselves really pack a punch allowing you to execute some very gruesome and disgusting executions; I think there are at least ten, all of which look really cool… If you happen to be a sadist, which we all are. Then there are the powers, eating hearts to gain health, rapid fire explosive bullets and lobbing black holes just to name a few. You will have a ton of fun tearing your way through the city.The creators were going for an art style that was reminiscent of a graphic novel and they really hit the nail on the head. The game is beautiful in its own dark way. The environments were nothing too special but each one had its own feel and lent to the overall bleak atmosphere. As for the story, it was pretty good, nothing too amazing but it allowed the player to exact bloody vengeance and tug at the heart strings as well.Besides the main single player campaign, which only lasts a few hours, there is also a second game mode that can be undertaken in single or multiplayer. In it you get to play as one of four new characters all with their own dark weapons and powers. It added a lot more longevity to the title and with the unique storyline it is well worth a play. I had a go with all the characters to see which one suited me best before blasting my way through everyone who looked at me funny.This game is awesome and frankly it is very underrated. If you pick this up you will find a very enjoyable and bombastic adventure that will have you want to play through a couple times. Even at full price it’s a good title but on sale you would be mad not to pick it up.Have fun  ^_^

content:
Posted: July 20, 2013
												The Darkness 2 is a game that tries to break from the conventional game molds and provide you with something completely unique. The result is a masterpiece, placing it as the best game of 2012 for me.You control Jackie Estacado, a mafia lord who has the power of Darkness itself. The atmosphere of the game and graphics really makes the world vibrant, while the characters are all amazing. From the dialogue to the story, it goes beyond just being solid and keeps you in the whole thing through. A must experience.Gameplay wise is shines just as well. You can control the darkness, represented by 2 serpent heads, through your mouse and keyboard. Between grabbing enemies, blowing them away, beating them down, throwing them, or performing the gruesome finishers you always feel like it's a fun experience. You start off feeling like a god and progress to the more difficult enemies. It works out really well.The biggest downside to the game is that it's very short. You can beat the main campaign in a few hours, but you'll end up going through it a couple of times for the fun achievements and maxing out all of the ability trees that carry over to New Game+. You can play in side missions with other characters that lets you experience a parallel story (ie, While Jackie was doing so and so, these guys were doing this to help). They also have dark powers that are all unique. This can be played in single player on lower difficulties or in co-op on higher. The story is the same for all of them, but it's still a great additional mode.While this game has multiplayer, in my opinion it shines best as a single player experience. The weapons are fun, the enemies are great, the storyline is a masterpiece and the game looks and feels amazing. It's something I feel everyone owes it to themselves to get. The only gripe I could have is that there's no announced sequel or dlc. 10/10 - Get it. It goes on sale for such a low price that it should be a sin not to pick up a copy.

Posted: September 5, 2016
												The start up audio is extremely loud despite any sound settings. The game gave me an annoying blur effect glitch throughout the entire experience which made it much more difficult and unpleasant than it had to be since enemies will use light and flashbangs to put blur effects on your screen already. Expect plenty of blurring in the second half of the game. The kill animations are repetitive which is fine except when some of them take much longer than the others to finish (Anaconda vs Head Whip) and become very annoying. The game also really wanted me to use my controller since it didn't respond too well with mouse and keyboard. I didn't know the Darkness being bad news was referring to the port quality. Ohoho.Despite all of that, I finished the game. It's extremely gory, has combat I haven't experienced before (big reason I finished), has a short to medium length, and ends on a huge cliffhanger that left me wanting more, but I don't think there will be a third one (sadness).The combat has you wielding three different guns that you harvest off the dead or find and utilizing the Darkness as you see fit. The general weapon categories are pistols, smgs, rifles, and shotguns. I was a big fan of dual-wielding Desert Eagles. The Darkness on the other hand can pick up and throw various objects and people. You can also grab shields with it, throw your Darkling buddy, perform executions for health, ammo, reduced powers cooldown, summon swarms, enhance your bullets, and much more depending on what you decide to purchase on the four skill trees. You also have your dependable tentacle melee attacks that will slice people in half horizontally and vertically. Making your tentacles, guns, and powers all work together kept me interested in the game along with the revenge style story.Unfortunately, the game has many problems. My problems weren't restricted to my experience either going off of what I read in the hub and in reviews. That's enough to not recommend this title, although, if you're curious, maybe pick it up on sale or if it ever pops up in a bundle again. From the bang for buck perspective, $30 is a very tall order for this title.

content:
Posted: August 8, 2013
												While loving the first, The Darkness 2 felt like a disappointment.You are two years later, and are still very much feeling the aftermath. You're a Don now, leading a crime organisation that seems to feel smaller than implied.You go to a restaurant and get attacked by a bunch of janitors. Almost intently, they force you to survive by releasing the Darkness, which Jackie had locked up ever since last time.What follows is a path of revenge. First to retalliate, then avenge your Aunt, then recover a plot-vital artifact... you're basically on a railroad of motivations, which feels artificial.No surprise that the story really isn't engaging.But the surrounding side characters are a redeeming factor. NPC's are often in pairs and have some funny banter. And spamming talk to hear them out leads into a long strain of comments about their own backstory. They may be somewhat shallow characters, but there's a sense of personality to them.In particular, the Darkling seems to be filled with it. He slowly starts to play a big part in the story, and is generally a hoot to listen to. A major improvenemt over the first game.Gameplay wise, what's changed isn't per se for the better.You still have your whip, but it feels much shorter and riskier to use to whip out lights. It relies on your input to see what direction to swipe, which feels counter-intuitive.You can grab a car door or anything shield-like to carry in front of you as protection while you shoot. A great idea at first, but impractical over time, as eating hearts removes the shield and you can't use the whip. Not to mention that the smallest light drops it.Not much of a problem at first, until you start encountering the Brotherhood...Corpses still carry hearts to consume, but living ones serve a different purpose now as well.Instead of four awesome Darkness powers, your powers now largely revolve around stunning an enemy, then grasping him.Upon which you can then decide what to do with them.Mainly, they can serve as a quick health refill, an ammo refill (yep), a shield creator or a cooldown reducer.You also have two active cooldown-based abilities.One is swarm, which briefly blind/stuns your enemy, making them vulnerable. The other briefly infuses your guns with the Darkness, giving you infinite ammo and raised damage. But it's not really a lifesaver.All of this fancy stuff however has to be unlocked first, using points you earn in combat. The fancier the kill, the more points you get.In general, the upgrades are okay. They're nothing spectacular. Although the Darkness armor does look mighty nice. It seems based upon the armor from the comics.In the end, I felt like the Darkness was more of a crutch that slowed me down. I was constantly juggling with my Gunplay and my Darkness powers, annoyingly so.The Brotherhood, which past halfway will be your mainstay enemies, often carry light-beams, which will just annoy the hell out of you. Whenever you are in light now, your screen goes black and white and drop any non-weapon you are holding (such as shields). It's quite disruptive.Not to mention the Whip guys.... These guys will snatch whatever weapon you are holding.Or the shielders who knock you around, while requiring either swarm or multiple whip slashing to be knocked away.Or the Heavy guys that, for some reason, blink around the place whenever they are hurt.These guys get my vote as most-annoying ever.Thankfully you're done with the story in about eight hours.Vendettas seems to largely be a redeeming feature.You can pick one of four that each have one Darkness ability.This is a good thing, as the focus seems to be much more on the gunplay. You still get the annoying light effect, but you feel much less disabled.Quite frankly, I feel like I'm having a much better time in Vendettas.The Darkness 2 is like a bad sequel to a good movie. You cringe, but you can still see what you liked about the original.Get it while it's on sale, play the Single Player on Easy and try and make the best out of it...

content:
Posted: December 29, 2013
												Let's start at the very beginning for this one. I played the first Darkness on the 360 until my thumbs went numb. If you played it, you know that the story was compelling, and it was pretty much the only thing that kept you playing it (of course, besides the demon slashing, heart eating, and generally dark ambience), but the gameplay was lacking. Hard.Now, I went into The Darkness II not knowing what to expect, whether it would be a fantastic sequel (hell, all sequels are good, right? ... right?) or yet another crappy game living off of a great story. Well, it turned out to be the former.The storytelling on The Darkness II is near perfection. It is short, granted, but the pacing is godly, and the voice acting is outstanding. The voice of the Darkness, Mike Patton, couldn't be better, portraying the wretchedness of it perfectly. The new gameplay mechanics, including your oh so familiar akimbo mastery and the use of your additional two limbs (which are surprisingly easy to handle) were most definitely a step forward in this title. The upgrade system is a bit lacking, though, but all things considered, it's only a minor setback.The visual style is arguably more simplistic than that of the first game, but it doesn't make it any less enjoyable. The sound in the game is excellent, with weapons as loud as hell, and bone brunching all the way to the end.And if you thought it would get repetitive after a while, never think it, for the multiplayer is there to solve that! Paint the town red with your enemies' blood, slice them up to tiny bits with your demon arm, execute your enemies in gruesome ways and feel the darkness take over you.This is a must-play for any action FPS enthusiast out there.

Posted: March 16, 2015
												A highly underrated game that deserves to be played for the story and gunplay. If you're not into the linear shooter than I guess you should avoid this, but for what it is, the game is an amazing experience. Far too few games nowadays do not come with a good story that actually grasps the player's interest. There are some moments in the game where it seems illogical, like invincible light bulbs(you and the darkness powers are vulnerable in the presence of light), but everything else is pretty darn fun. If you can look past the bugs here and there, the game is worth your time and hopefully a sequel isn't too far around the corner. The multiplayer though, is not very interesting, and is probably best to avoid it and just enjoy the singleplayer story. Now onto the pro's and con's.Pros:Great gunplayFun and awesome powers New game+lovely storyVisuals are neatCons:Some bugs here and there, I got quite a bit of visual bugsI don't think the darkling is used enough besides throwing himLinear? May be a con for some, but I enjoyed the pacing.Fairly shortInvincible light bulbs

Posted: December 13, 2013
												Somebody will be upset over the comparisons I'm about to make to describe this game *SMH* This games single player mode is utterly fun, AND hilarious, it's like they combined 1a the really good recent "stereotype" mobsters/Mafia games, with one of the recent console "have Dark/Evil powers+ mutant body parts" (I'd be more specific, but We all know the two games I mean) games. This Co. used to be part of Sega, and that quality shows, the game looks, sounds, plays, and runs awesome, PLUS unlike lots of games it is FUN to play. Personally I purchased this game because I know 2K games don't make junk, AND because I wanted to play the online 4 player mode, and it's UTTERLY cool, but I was so suprised by the story mode that I'll surely finish that too. The online "Vendetta" modes are great, if you pick the story 1, it's like playing through Saints Row IV (don't hate Me), with the most stereotyped 4 chars from Saints Row 2 (ALL good things), in a city that's cool, and realistic looking, you can revive your team-mates if they die, you get powers, and buffs you purchase with skillpoints you gain from killing mobs, the mobs and feal of the game is also reminding Me of the latest Devil May Cry game, Yes the Co-Op modes are short, but if you turn the difficulty up they last longer, & gives you a better sense of accomplishment.Personally I hate the "We're to lazy to make a conformant texture clamp that works well on the player model skins, so We CARTOON-OUTLINED them", but it's only on the player skins, and not the world, so you hardly notice, The contrast is so high it'll make your eyes bleed with the awesome job they did on the lighting, & overall feel/look of the game. It'll run on any old PC, and even looks good with everything turned on low, in the lowest rez. So If you like games to just chill awhile, N blast through a Co-Op that ROCKS, or a cool story mode that's VERY entertaining, this game's worth it at normal price, so get it on sale ☺

content:
Posted: July 19, 2014
												The game is short, I beat it in 8 hours and I was not trying to rush in any way.  That being said, my time with it was a joy in both multiplayer and singleplayer.  Dodging the light to stay in the darkness is an interesting and unique mechanic.  The fact that you essentially have another arm with your darkness powers adds a layer of depth(you can duel weild guns while holding a shield with the darkness).  It's a gruesome game and you feel like a dark god of vengence as you go through it, you feel powerful but challenged which is an interesting blend.  You have to eat hearts with the tentacles for health but it doesn't impede your movement in any way, just a cool thing to watch the tentacle reach out and do it while you are shooting.  Oh and your guy is a good guy.  One of the main detractors that kept me from buying the game for a long time was I thought he was this super evil guy that was just killing people for fun, he's a good guy that is getting revenge, like the punisher or max payne. Overall great game.

content:
Posted: March 16, 2015
												A highly underrated game that deserves to be played for the story and gunplay. If you're not into the linear shooter than I guess you should avoid this, but for what it is, the game is an amazing experience. Far too few games nowadays do not come with a good story that actually grasps the player's interest. There are some moments in the game where it seems illogical, like invincible light bulbs(you and the darkness powers are vulnerable in the presence of light), but everything else is pretty darn fun. If you can look past the bugs here and there, the game is worth your time and hopefully a sequel isn't too far around the corner. The multiplayer though, is not very interesting, and is probably best to avoid it and just enjoy the singleplayer story. Now onto the pro's and con's.Pros:Great gunplayFun and awesome powers New game+lovely storyVisuals are neatCons:Some bugs here and there, I got quite a bit of visual bugsI don't think the darkling is used enough besides throwing himLinear? May be a con for some, but I enjoyed the pacing.Fairly shortInvincible light bulbs

												Darkness II is a hack & slash & shoot game with really cool and fun abilities. You got the power of The DarknessYou are head of the crime family. You got awesome "tentacles" coming from your back that basically wreck anything apart.You get "Dark Essence" from executions, kills collectable relics. You can use that essence for new abilities or upgrades.This game has an interesting story of Jackie Estecado ( you ) trying to take down a society called "The Brotherhood", who wants The Darkness from you. Jackie is desperate to get her old girlfriend back who was killed by Jackie controlled by Darkness. The game also has "Vendettas" mode. It's Co-Op (and SP) where you play as other character who have partial powers of Darkness.Relics can be collected. There are 29 total. They are not hard to find, which is good. You don't want to get frustrated.You should buy this game, if you love slashing and mutilating AND shooting people to complete slush. The Single Player is not  long. If you take your time looking around, it might take 8 to 10 hours. If you speedrun the game, it takes about 3 hours. Achievements are fun. They are easy and bit challenging, they still come eventually. Great voice acting and art-style is lovely.This game was entertaining, I completed it 4 times without even noticing ( because of achivements ) This game deserves 9/10EDIT: The Darkness II is really linear

Posted: February 13, 2012
												Short but sweet. I started playing this with a controller, just so I could play it on my TV, but honestly, a controller just doesn't work. Or you must have played a lot of console FPS already, then you might get used to it. So I switched back to my normal monitor. This game looks astonishing. I love the cel shaded graphics, they're detailed and the gore looks great in motion. The animations were great as well. One thing they should've looked into was the FOV. It's all messed up so there's a good chance you might actually get sick because of it. I did hear they were working on that though.The voiceovers and music were brilliant as well. I especially loved the music of the ending, and the voice of The Darkness.But... like most FPS these days, this is a short game. It will take about 6 hours to finish, then you can start New Game+ if you want. Or play the co-op missions, your choice. I started over after finishing it. The shooting and killing in general just feel right ♥ ![Rating: 90/100]

content:
Posted: November 2, 2012
												This is one of the few FPS in recent history that I've legitimately enjoyed. The story isn't the most interesting thing ever, and it is rather short, but it keeps moving at a brisk pace, and several unexpected things happen along the way. I loved the asylum levels in particular.The graphics are pretty good (especially given the low requirements), and the voice acting is really well-done. The darkness powers are rather interesting, and add quite a bit to the battles. You can level up the ones you use, and ignore the ones you don't. Picking up poles or shields and tossing them at enemies is crazy fun, and you can swipe with the darkness arms while you reload, etc. There are a few cover-shooting sections, but there are also several frantic wide-open brawls with large groups of enemies.There are numerous multiplayer modes, as well as New Game+, so you should get your money's worth out of it. I certainly did.

content:
Posted: December 30, 2015
												One of the better fps games I've ever played. Solid, unflinching combat mechanics, great graphics, cool story, and a lot of fun to play. Not only can you dual wield weapons, you have two demon arms that come out of you to slash and grab enemies and do gruesome executions, and you can grab items and throw them at enemies. The ultra-violence in this game knows no limits. Another big plus: the story is easily one of the best video game stories I've ever seen. Simple to grasp yet very well written and well acted, even sad at times. The graphics are also very well done and hold up well today even as of 2016, with a almost Borderlands-ish comic style. But things look more human-like and the game is much more serious than BL games, and it manages to feel like its own style of art.If you like well made FPS games that feel nice and tight when you play them, like a young, hot, 18yr old super-long haired red head prom date with a quiver in her panties that you can feel on your leg while dancing, quit waiting and go for it.Gameplay 9/10Graphics 8/10Effects 8/10Performance 10/10Sounds/music 9/10Story 10/10Length 9/10Replay value 7/10Level of Violence 10/10Technical problems: none for me/108.5/10 one of my fav fps games

												While I have not played the first Darkness game, I am in love with this one. The aesthetic is fantastic and looks great not matter what settings you play on, the gameplay brings something new to the genre of linear shooters, the story is gripping and I had a lot of fun learning the lore of the story in general.Pros:- Interesting use of light as a mechanic - Duel wielding semi-automatic guns- Interesting story- Being able to slash people with a shadowy tentacle from hell- Being able to pick up people and throw them into walls and watching their corpse rag doll onto the ground- Upgrade systemCons:- Game is really linear- Is fairly basic in terms of how many mechanics it providesIf you want a game to provide you a power trip, this is what this game excels at and I recommend it highly. If you are not seeking a power trip and want to try a new game that has some interesting mechanics and brings something new to the genre, I would still recommend it.

content:
Posted: April 6, 2012
												First of all, I like the Darkness ll. It's a game that's linear and typical in terms of envrionment design, but oh so fun to play when it comes to story and gameplay.The Darkness is the ultimate weapon, you can use it to melee, grab, and literally tear apart enemies. I love the idea of relying on the dark to access the darkness abilities. You can upgrade your powers using points gathered through kills and finding collectibles. The weapons are awesome, quite a few to choose from and they all sound great and make a great addition to the darkness powers.There are several choices throughout the story as well. The character animations bring the characters to life and the enemies act like living breathing people rather than dull AI that just tries to kill you.The cell shaded graphics are something I'm not a fan of, but they still pull off a good looking game world.Only two things I don't like about The Darknesss ll:1.) The small scale levels.2.) Its short single player campaign.

content:
Posted: July 13, 2012
												If you've played the first game you're going to notice a few things.1.) The visual style. Depending on your preference this is either a good or a bad thing. Personally, I preferred the more realistic style in the first game, it just made it feel much darker and gritty (which is what you'd expect out of a game called "The Darkness"). I can see why they did it, as the franchise is based on a comic. 2.) The music. Remember the epic metal-orchestral soundtrack that featured when you were ripping everything apart? Well, that's not there any more. Compare this: 


YouTube™ Video: The Darkness [Music] - Massacre On The Lighthouse 

			Views: 135,969		

			http://www.2kgames.com/thedarkness/		

 with this: 


YouTube™ Video: The Darkness II Soundtrack - I Got My Gun Again 

			Views: 11,055		

			Soundtrack von The Darkness II Titel: I Got My Gun Again		

 and you'll get what I mean. It's good, but it just doesn't have enough "oomf" behind it for my liking.3.) Very linear. The pseudo-free-roam that was present in the first game is gone too, everything narrows you down a linear path. Sure there are some "choices" that you make that effect some things, but that's pretty much it.In summary: fun gameplay, iffy style.

												Overall a very good game, nothing particularlly new here but everything is well executed* the story is interesting enough to keep you engaged and the gameplay is solid. The art style is the real winner here. The first The Darkness suffered from poor visuals and blockly looks along with a light mechanic that was cool in concept but not so much in gameplay. All that is fixed by simply cell shading everything.The fluidity of the combat is very impressive as well, you'll go from shooting guys in the face to disembowling them with your claws to ripping car doors off of cars for cover all without missing a beat. There is great attention paid to detail in the level design and non consequential objects placed around the levels. Voice acting is surprisingly good. The length of the main campaign is maybe a little short for $30, but if you catch it on sale for $25 or less I'd say you'll get your money's worth.Overall a very enjoyable time was had playing and I'll probably fork over a couple of bucks for DLC if and when it hits, assuming it's single player content.*Only gripe is a bug that doesn't like to let you walk through doorways that require crouching (ventilation shafts, tunnels, you know the type if you've played a shooter since Goldeneye). You have to disable the Vsynch or enable it. Doesn't matter which, you just have to change it to walk through the door and change it back to get through another one. It doesn't happen often, but it sucks you right out of the game when it does.

												The Darkness II was one of those games I finished without ever getting up from the PC, literally. First, because its really catching, but second because it's also really short. I easily managed to fit in those 5h playtime between lunch and dinner.  The Darkness II is amazing, and one of the best games I played in a while. Its not necessary to have played the first part to get the story, but I am going to buy it now. I easily immersed into the story and all the characters are well made and believable. Overall it was well written and it all fitted together. I also love the musik.Surprisingly the game run perfectly fine without ever lagging on my old Computer. I never found any performance issues and still the graphics are amazing. This games gets a 9,5/10 rating. The minuses are short campaign, repetitive bossfights and sometimes stupid AI.

content:
Posted: June 29, 2014
												8/10 - good game, a bit short but really, really funYou can tear people apart, slice them in pieces, impale them on metal rods and all sorts of fun executions on top of applying some generous amount of lead in their body. The gameplay revolves around controlling your player's dark powers that will allow you to grab objects or bodies and throw them, with the small (but very annoying) limit that your powers only work in the "dark". There's a fair bit of shooting people in the face with your usual FPS weapons, including the pretty neat dual wield of different lightweight guns, meaning you can shoot people with a UMP45 and a M1911 to make sure you empty both your pistol and SMG ammo pools in a jiffy. Also, a british as balls sidekick that is a buttload of fun to hear.You can of course purchase upgrades and new powers, that will increase the power of your bullets, let you see through walls, stun enemies or rip them apart in new and exciting ways.The storyline picks up after the first game (that I never played, thanks console exclusives) and is pretty nice. It begs for a sequel though, that will probably never happen considering it hasn't been announced yet.On top of that SP mode (and its New Game+ option that allows you to start the game with your upgrades - a great way to make the hardest difficulty mode a little bit less frustrating), there's a coop mode where you assume the role of one of the 4 totally stereotypical, borderline racist characters available in that mode. Each character has a new ability: the chinese dude has a katana, the jew girl has a really neat pistol/shotgun/bringer of death, the black healer guy can throw people in the air and the irish guy can throw an axe on top of reusing one of the SP mode's PC abilities. It's possible to rip and tear with your friends!Technically, the game looks pretty good but the performance is all over the place. Sometimes the framerate tanked as low as 15 FPS while on some other places of the same level it was above 100 FPS.Overall, the game is pretty short but nevertheless good.Did I mention you can destroy people? Like, put one of your demonic arms in their butt and pull their spine out?

The game is extremely gorey which I personally didn't find an issue but it won't be to some people's tastes. However the gameplay is solid and the story is brilliant with plenty of depth and makes you want to continue playing to find out more.  9/10, would strongly recommend (also remember to watch right to the end of the credits, there's an extra clip that adds a lot to the story)

Posted: August 23, 2016
												Has some unique gameplay elements, is brutal and provoking at times. However, checkpoint system is really bad, with many swarms of enemy being dolled at you up to 5 guys at a time which are very fast to kill you. Not to mention they are also bullet sponges and they have really awkward hitboxes making headshots more difficult to pull off than they should. The game looks awful at native resolutions without a super/multi-sample solution in-game, and the control scheme works much better with a gamepad.That being said, you don't need to worry about not playing the first game to get the jist of this one. The combat is other-wise very fast-paced at times, with enemys constantly dropping big "health packs" to keep you going through the firefights.(Sometimes the checkpoints will mess with this mechanic) And despite my complaints, I feel like I got spoiled from the $1 Humble Bundle this came in. It's definitely a game that deserves to be played, though $30 is WAY to much to ask for, considering its age and I say you should definitely wait for a sale.

												This game seriously kicks hard, this is such an amazing successor to the hidden awesome gem of an original. Looking totally different this time trying to get the look, touch and style of the comic books. This time you can use your darkness tentacles for much better use and with superior combat. Game rides an interesting story but it doesn't out do the original's though. Keeps up the top-notch voice acting from the original, introducing new voice actors or voices from the original voice actors. This game had quite a decent bit of replayability. A pretty decent co-op campaign, vendettas and hitlists. The only thing that let's this down is it's generally short campaign, though it's not that bad "6-7 hours" but with the co-op campaigns it adds "3-4 hours" so altogether it's around "9-11" hours which is not bad at all. This game was so much kickass fun, I just have to reccommend it. This and the original are some of my favorite games of all time. Totally recommended and fun as hell.

content:
Posted: August 9, 2015
												So me, Johnny the Knife and Rodrigo the Snake was attendin' sunday mass. And there was those creepy lookin' guys there: all dressed up in black, huge guys, I didn't know'em, but I knew they was hitmen of some sorts. With tatoos all over the place and some wicked cross upside down I could see one the sleeve of one of em. I knew the other guys saw 'em, too and THEY saw us. I had no idea man, they was watchin' us all the time and we was gettin' ready for a fight. And they sure as hell would bring one down on us.The priest goin all fire and brimstone today. Like hell wasn't a made up story to keep us in line, but a REAL place, where each of us could end up. Finally we were gettin up for singin when all of a sudden BOOM! the church doors crashed open! Next thing you know some crazy hail of bullets was rainin all over the place! And before anyone had any ♥♥♥♥in' clue what the crap was goin on, those huge guys, they was droppin' like flys. Just like that! They went down like rocks in the river. So we thought it was some kind of hitman, you know, from another family, crashin the party. But then I saw IT! All of us was takin cover behind the curch benches and between the screamin deaths of two of those giants there was some...some kind of tentacle, a snake, hell I don't know. It had glowin' eyes! Black skin and big ♥♥♥♥in teeth! And it was rippin them apart like some crazy anaconda-cobra from hell. I thought I was goin crazy. Everyone was screamin, like their ♥♥♥♥in soul was on the line! The priest shouted: "IT IS SATAN! IT IS SATAN!"Then Rodrigo got hit! I was tryin to get to him, but out of nowhere the whole room got filled with one mean swarm of ♥♥♥♥ed up bugs. Huge, disgusting monsterbugs! Everyone got stung and stunned. And then...this THING jumped on Johnnys back! Poundin him like a ragin gorilla. Laughin while it did it. First thing I did as soon as I could move again was runnin for my god damn life! I crawled and hid behind the altar. The priest was dead: lied there in his own blood, the robe  wrapped around his shredded face. I looked for side exits, or a ladder, anything! But then...then IT jumped right at the altar!! I tried to scream, but couldn't. It was a demon, a fallen angel, a beast, it was...THE DARKNESS!! As I was gettin ready to die, I screamed: "WHAT ARE YOU!?" Deadcertain those would be my last words. But then, out of this cloud, appeared a face! It was a man...! And all cool, like death itself, he said with a smooth voice: "I...am the hero! And you will not die today." I was starin in his face, unable to say a single word. Suddenly I could hear another boomin voice, like it was in my own god damn head, I thought it came from his tentacles. And they raged: "WE WANT ITS HEART! FEED US! FEED US ITS HEART!" And that was when I passed out into a pitchblack abyss, knowing for sure I would never return from it.So...would I recommend this game? HELL YES!

content:
Posted: February 13, 2016
												The Darkness 2 is, as the name implies, pretty ♥♥♥♥ing dark.You play as Jackie Estacado, a mobster whose special skills have allowed him to rise to the very top of the New York underworld. And by 'special skills,' I am of course referring to the ancient demonic entity that lives within his body.But when a bunch of cultists show up and try to steal the power away from him (because if an ordinary guy can use it to become king of the Mafia, imagine what someone with actual ambition could do with it), Jackie must use his eldritch abilities, and a veritable ♥♥♥♥load of increasingly large guns, to defend himself and prevent the power from falling into the wrong hands.I'll be honest, I was surprised by how much I liked this game. I picked it up expecting a standard shooter with a vaguely gothic design aesthetic. What I wasn't expecting was a genuinely inventive and unique game with solid gameplay and some smart ideas bubbling under the surface. There are some very creative moments throughout the campaign, first as Jackie explores some strange locations, and then later when the demonic presence starts to drive him insane. The ending also qualifies for the 'Holy ♥♥♥♥ing Christ' award of totally unexpected story turns.The gameplay is the standard gory shooter, but with the twist of dark and brutal abilities. You have two demonic tentacles which can pick up and throw things independant of your two gun-hands, which led to several situations where I was fighting two battles at once- a mid-range skirmish with a pair of SMGs, and also a long-range stand-off in which I was lobbing sharp objects and spikes at snipers.You also get health by eating hearts that you tear out of dead bodies, which means the only way to get your way out of a tight spot is to use progressively riskier tactics to kill enemies and regain the upper hand.Overall, it's a surprisingly enjoyable game with some creative uses of mechanics to craft a campaign that is not only fun to play, but fun as an experience.Final score: 8/10.

Posted: February 2, 2016
												Short version with 0 spoliers:  The Darkness II is a good but short game.Long version possibly containing spoilers:  On the brightside if you're like me, you didn't play The Darkness and just happened to come across The Darkness II while it was on sale and decided it would be worth a play.  I opened the game with kind of low expectations because it just look liked Hatred with a bit more of a story behind it with demons and♥♥♥♥♥♥  Little did I know that I would be hearing a lot of familiar voices from Mafia II.  I'll start it off by talking a bit about the controls in this game, I assume the game was meant to be operated with a controller because the attacking with darkness via the mouse is very clunky, but not clunky to the point that the game is made easy, otherwise it controls like a typical FPS.  The integration of The Darkness made the gameplay more interesting than the typical FPS luckily.  The graphics aren't even bad considering the 2012 release period.  Getting more into the story element part of the review, I have to say that the storyline took me a bit by surprise, it's not as emotional as it could be given the situation but otherwise the dialogue is well written and is even at some parts, humorous.  The little sidekick you get is probably one of my favorite parts of the game, aside from the intense gore which isn't even really that intense but it's definitely what drove me through the game.  One part in particular which is after you finish killing a boss.  Now to the one but small point that kind of bothered me, turns out this game is super short.  I beat the whole main story in one hour, there is side coop stuff you can do with friends and♥♥♥♥♥♥but I, a friendless ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥, really don't care about that now do I?  Eh small complaint, still a good game worth checking out.

content:
Posted: February 13, 2016
												The Darkness 2 is, as the name implies, pretty ♥♥♥♥ing dark.You play as Jackie Estacado, a mobster whose special skills have allowed him to rise to the very top of the New York underworld. And by 'special skills,' I am of course referring to the ancient demonic entity that lives within his body.But when a bunch of cultists show up and try to steal the power away from him (because if an ordinary guy can use it to become king of the Mafia, imagine what someone with actual ambition could do with it), Jackie must use his eldritch abilities, and a veritable ♥♥♥♥load of increasingly large guns, to defend himself and prevent the power from falling into the wrong hands.I'll be honest, I was surprised by how much I liked this game. I picked it up expecting a standard shooter with a vaguely gothic design aesthetic. What I wasn't expecting was a genuinely inventive and unique game with solid gameplay and some smart ideas bubbling under the surface. There are some very creative moments throughout the campaign, first as Jackie explores some strange locations, and then later when the demonic presence starts to drive him insane. The ending also qualifies for the 'Holy ♥♥♥♥ing Christ' award of totally unexpected story turns.The gameplay is the standard gory shooter, but with the twist of dark and brutal abilities. You have two demonic tentacles which can pick up and throw things independant of your two gun-hands, which led to several situations where I was fighting two battles at once- a mid-range skirmish with a pair of SMGs, and also a long-range stand-off in which I was lobbing sharp objects and spikes at snipers.You also get health by eating hearts that you tear out of dead bodies, which means the only way to get your way out of a tight spot is to use progressively riskier tactics to kill enemies and regain the upper hand.Overall, it's a surprisingly enjoyable game with some creative uses of mechanics to craft a campaign that is not only fun to play, but fun as an experience.Final score: 8/10.

												Short version with 0 spoliers:  The Darkness II is a good but short game.Long version possibly containing spoilers:  On the brightside if you're like me, you didn't play The Darkness and just happened to come across The Darkness II while it was on sale and decided it would be worth a play.  I opened the game with kind of low expectations because it just look liked Hatred with a bit more of a story behind it with demons and♥♥♥♥♥♥  Little did I know that I would be hearing a lot of familiar voices from Mafia II.  I'll start it off by talking a bit about the controls in this game, I assume the game was meant to be operated with a controller because the attacking with darkness via the mouse is very clunky, but not clunky to the point that the game is made easy, otherwise it controls like a typical FPS.  The integration of The Darkness made the gameplay more interesting than the typical FPS luckily.  The graphics aren't even bad considering the 2012 release period.  Getting more into the story element part of the review, I have to say that the storyline took me a bit by surprise, it's not as emotional as it could be given the situation but otherwise the dialogue is well written and is even at some parts, humorous.  The little sidekick you get is probably one of my favorite parts of the game, aside from the intense gore which isn't even really that intense but it's definitely what drove me through the game.  One part in particular which is after you finish killing a boss.  Now to the one but small point that kind of bothered me, turns out this game is super short.  I beat the whole main story in one hour, there is side coop stuff you can do with friends and♥♥♥♥♥♥but I, a friendless ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥, really don't care about that now do I?  Eh small complaint, still a good game worth checking out.

content:
Posted: October 30, 2015
												The Darkness 2 game is loosely based on the comic incarnation of the Darkness, but the loose interpretation is fine and doesn't detreact from the game.  It's fun for a few hours, but has limited lifespan and very limited replay-ability.  If you can get this on deep discount then you won't begrudge paying a few quid for a few hours of entertainment, but I cannot recommend this at full price.So what's good:> fun slashing everything up with your demon limbs> comic-style visuals, similar to Borderlands> you play an evil b*st*rd in a world full of similarly evil b*st*rds, and sometimes it's fun to be the bad guyWhat's not so good:> it's a frenetic hack / slash / shoot 'em up with very little progression or thought.  Your tactics don't change much from the start and with only a few different types of enenmies, it quickly becomes repetative> there's a big issue with the depth of field - at certain points in the game the screen goes blurry for a scripted event.  Fine... but it often doesn't 'unblur' afterwards, and frenetic action when you can't see what's going on isn't fun.  This isn't just me, just google 'Darkness 2 depth of field' and see.> does help if you know the Darkness from the comicThe real pity is that it's a great idea, which has been rushed out of the door before it's ready.

content:
Posted: May 3, 2015
												Darkness 2 is a first person shooter with fantastic story elements, environments, sound and voice acting. The story of Darkness 2 pulls you in very quickly. The cut scenes are in first person, so you feel like you’re right there in the middle of everything. I truly did want to progress in the game because of how involved I got with the plot. I will preface this review by saying I would VERY HIGHLY RECOMMEND USING A XBOX 360 CONTROLLER More on that later… Let’s start with gameplay. Being able to control 2 guns and 2 deadly serpents attached at your shoulders at the same time makes for some killer combos and devastating enemy deaths. The game is very brutal with serpent deaths. Tearing off heads and ripping in half is just a taste. Being that the game is called Darkness, you need to stay in the shadows as the light will disable your serpents and make it difficult to see to fire on your enemies. This effect is truly disabling and you will not survive fighting in the light for long. You can collect various amounts of essence by killing enemies which you can trade in for various skills that will improve your character. There is a “skill reset” option so in case you find some skills are not good, you can reset everything for a small essence fee. Graphics and environments are stylized and really nicely done. It’s a split between comic book and real looking graphics. It fits right in with the story.Sound and voice acting are top notch. The Italian mob voices are fantastic and each character is unique. It was always a pleasure to hear dialogue back and forth between everyone. This game has a lot going on for in-game sound. It does get fairly noisy at times but that’s just an observation, not a complaint. Controls…they take getting used to. I tried this game using a mouse and keyboard but I found myself struggling. Switching to a 360 controller instantly corrected everything BUT the learning curve is still moderate. Stick with it and it’ll eventually become pretty natural. Stability and FPS are rock solid. Never crashed once on Windows 8.1 and got a solid 60fps throughout the game. Correct blurry view bugMany times during the game my view would become slightly blurry. Like the game forgot to reset back the focus. The simple fix when that happens was to take a screenshot. It fixed it instantly each time. It did get annoying as sometimes it would happen during intense battles and I’d have to take a second to reach the screenshot key. Pros+Graphics, environment, story, gameplay and sound are all very well done+Solid 60fps+Brutal enemy deaths+Solid variety of enemies+Slight replay value with new game ++Vendetta missionsCons+Controls take getting used to (use 360 controller)+Shouldn’t be so many unbreakable lights. +Some erratic graphical glitches throughout the game. But didn’t take away from anything+Combat can get somewhat boring+Darkling and Darkness tips can be repetitiveBottom line is that Darkness 2 is a good and seemingly underrated game. 7/10 Good

content:
Posted: May 17, 2016
												TL;DR: If you're like me, one of the rare people who haven't tried the Darkness II until now, then the Darkness II probably won't be all that interesting for you. I wouldn't pay more than 20 dollars for this game.Pros:+Solid story/setting. There's a sort of yin/yang feel to the setting of the story due to the duality of some of major element in the setting.+Solid game mechanics. The ability to grab poles and fan blade to use as projectile to impale or slice enemy is probably one of the most satisfying way to kill enemy and quite honestly, if not for the much more rewarding glitch explots I'll mention later on, I would use projectile much more often because it's sooooo satisfying.+Graphics is solid. I've seen quite a few games that for one reason or another decides to make the scene dark or greyish but just end up being monotone. The Darkness II, while most scene is set dingy, dark, still have a few colorful scene to keep things interesting.Cons:+Character development, beyond the protagonist is mostly one dimensional. Even though I just finished the game right now I really can't remember much about most of the supporting character, that's how generic, uninteresting they are.+There are few flaws in the level design. Couple area where you can fall off a higher floor level, thus making you walk through the same area you passed through earlier to get back up. It's not fatal or game breaking, just annoying.+There are several invisible wall in this game, some post on forums mention a fix that I didn't try because I just hop around the wall furiously for a few seconds and got through all of them, but it's possible that some others may get stuck there as well.+Game breaking glitches. Be warned, I'm about to talk about an exploits that'll probably ruin at least 80% of the main story campaign for you. If you still plan on playing the main story campaign (and you're interested in more than the story), I suggest you skip the last part and try getting the game on sale or something.One of Jackie's Darkness power is to melee execute enemy and either gain health, ammo, power refresh, or a shield; the problem is that while you're going through the melee execution animation, you're actually invincible, once I realises that part way through the game, I can body shot any light enemy, melee execute to gain some health, rinse and repeast until you killed every enemy. And yes, the boss of this game is very kind in that they'll send minions in for you to kill to make sure that your health is always up. Therefore, it's actually kind of hard to die if you learn to use that to your advantages.

content:
Posted: April 6, 2014
												UPDATED REVIEW:My biggest problem, is that there is not enough content in the game: the campaign is short, the coop missions are too easy and the coop campaign is too short.So I'd say it doesn't worth the money - if there is a discount maybe (but looking back I definitely wouldn't give more than 5 Euros for it).However, an interesting game, could have been a very good one. The base idea is interesting. Good gamespeed (in the short campaign you won't feel bored), average story, but it has a certain style (which is not for everyone). Maybe I would recommended for those, who like unique shooter games (FPS), and would like to have a really short game.The story: i won't make spoiler, it's not bad (i've seen much worse), but a little simple.The evolution of the skills are well-made, which is absolutely a good point.There are not so many guns, but that's not a problem, because at least, they are really not the same (i mean, there are real differences between two guns, not just the look of them).There are 3 major negatives:1. Graphic is bad. It is like a cartoon, but i think it wasn't a good choice.2. Story is very short. I walk through the campaign in 1 day.3. You are overpowered (mainly because of close combat - if you get close, you won). Even on highest difficulty, there aren't really difficult situations (maybe 1 or 2 during whole campaign). You can easily beat the coop missions alone.I would say, that it's an average game, good for a weekend, but not for more, so in conclusion I don't recommend it.If there will be a 3rd part, I would be interested in that, given that they change the graphic, and add much more story.

Can't stand hearing this anymore. But someday back in the 80s, Hollywood decided that's what demons sound like. And since this is one of the games that's desperate to be a movie, they throw every bad design decision at you that the desire to emulate a cinematic experience entails.Music: Both the wannabe-cinematic score and the licensed tracks suck so hard it almost makes me nostlagic... you know, back in the day when these ancient songs sucked so hard already?*'oh me, oh my, that darkness consumes me, eeeewwwoooh'. If it were possible to care negatively, I'd be at -100%. Yet, she's constantly thrust in my face and I have no choice but to constantly keep biting and swallow the mcguffin hook, line and sinker. Forced. Cheap. Irritating.'Cliché' isn't really a word I use all that often. Almost never. Yet it's a word I could use 100 times to describe this game, and I'd only just have scratched the surface. content:
Posted: October 15, 2014
												CONS1) Cell shading; is a plague on mankind. I understand The Darkness is based off a comic, I used to read it as a kid,  along with Witchblade. Albiet he looked ten times more badass in the comic, the cartoon filter over everthing does not make me feel like Im in the comic, it  makes me think like I'm slaughtering all the characters in toon town.  It takes away the sense of realism, and just makes all the over the top gore seem less visceral. The original game did not have quite as much gore, but it was ten times more real and satisfying without cell shading.  Maybe its ok to have in a game like Dragon Ball Z or Narruto because you're trying to make it look just like the show, but keep it out of FPS. Just because people like Borderlands doesn't mean it will work everytime. Personally I hate Borderlands, (but Im sure the game takes longer than 6 hours to beat). I suppose its also a way to avoid bad press if the game is way too violent and the cartoon look dampens the violence factor, but I dont think thats the case, and that imo is wimping out.2) Some abilities ruin the immersion of the game, there is one where anything you throw will explode on impact, and it doesnt really explode but it juts poofs into purple gas and completely disappears, including bodies, no bits, no metal shards, just purple gas.. and gone. Its not even a proper explosion and looks really cheaply done. I only got that ability to get the armor ability to see if it would look anything like how it did in the comic. the Darkness armor ability is pretty cool , but forcing you to have the stupid explode on impact perk is really annoying and not worth it. There are few other poorly thought out abilities , but that one is by far the worst.3) Guns are pretty generic, not many different models like they had in the first game. Instead they have abilities to power up guns with the darkness to make your bullets more powerful, thats all well and dandy, but I think they focused too much on those cartoonish abilities and not on actually giving you a good variety of weapons. Everytime you pick up a colt .45  its the same filigry inlayed 45 as the ones you start with. Like every goon in the game has Jackies signature custom .45's, like they are part of his fan club, its lazy. 4) The games too short, which is why if I spent more than $5 I would have felt ripped off.PROSas far as the PROS go there really arent that many other than its delightfully gorey, fluid enough gameplay and I only ran into one bug on the brothel level where you're in a vent, if you have a decent graphics card and have vsync turned off, you get stuck. Doesn't make any sense, but turn ON vsync for that part and you can pass, then turn that crap off. The story is pretty good but some of the characters get annoying like that guy in the beginning trailer of the game, I liked him at first but he gradually became more annoying as the game went on, his character was a little too overwhelming. I really liked seeing some old faces from the first game though, especially the Butcher. So in conclusion, I would recommend this game as long as you get it on a serious sale, and avoid some of the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ abilities.

												Nah.To be fair, it had some pretty neat ideas here and there but they were only surface level deep. The story is very uninspired and predictable which may be the fault of the source material which I'm not familiar with because I ain't got nothin in life by readin and I aint about to start. The world seems very "trying-to-be-gritty" for lack of a better term. Yeah we get it Darkness II ripping out a man's heart = so edgy, you're a real game now. Maybe if the game didn't try to play it so straight and played the events with more levity I could have enjoyed the story more but I guess the source material doesn't allow for that. The gameplay is serviceable and even challenging a times but it really feels by the numbers, no clever enemy AI, no emergent game systems, bad fps boss battles, and very straightforward level design. So when there are areas that are challenging it comes off as cheap rather than a failure in learning the games systems. There's a few areas where the cell shaded art style really creates some cool looking environments but there are just as many uninspired ones. I get that it is trying to do an arcade shooter but frankly there are better examples of this, and with better storytelling too. See Call of Juarez: Gunslinger or the new Shadow Warrior reboot. Those are far better games to play.

Without spoiling to much, the story revolves around the whole "I DON'T WANNA BE A TOTAL BAD♥♥♥♥♥SO I COMPLAIN ABOUT BEING A BADASS", I understand what its going for but its not really working. content:
Posted: May 25, 2013
												Please note: I have never played Darkness 1 nor read the comic books that the series is based on, so this review is going to be written from that perspective.Darkness 2 is a sequel to Darkness 1 that was only released for Playstation 3 and Xbox 360 and the franchise is in turn based on the comic book of the same title produced by Top Cow Productions.It tells the story of a mob boss Jackie Estacado and his tormented life living with a dark god / demon known as "The Darkness" which basically grants him immortality but slowly draining his humanity.The main problem with Darkness 2 is that being a sequel, the player effectively loses alot of backstory about how Jackie came into being. Sure, there is an optional skippable prelude story narration that briefly summarizes his story, but it still feels rather empty because some of the later story elements (Such as Jenny) would have been more emotional and powerful if you have played the first game.Gameplay itself is fun, and although primarily a FPS, you are given 2 tentacles that lets you eviscerate enemies in the most gruesome manner possible. Because the tentacles are so powerful, i find myself using tentacles most of the time and neglecting to use guns.It also makes use of a light and dark mechanic where your character will be more powerful when in darkness, and the tentacles will not be available when there is light.So the general gameplay goes like this:1) Use guns to shoot out any light source2) Use tentacles to eviscerate and kill3) Repeat.Graphics has a unique graphic novel look similar to a toned down Borderlands look and while not too bad, has a very jagged and rough look and bad frame rates even when put on the highest settings on a decent above recommendation computer. I suppose its a result of being a direct console port.While the story is entertaining, it is rather short at about 7 hours. There also isn't much actual gameplay, and close to 70% of the time, you are either looking at cutscenes or scripted events.Just a little observation i've noticed.I also find it strange that every enemy would be so gung-ho to charge at you even after seeing what you've done.Example: If you were to see your friend getting ripped apart at the spinal cord by a guy with 2 evil looking dark tentacles, would you still try to attack him? I know i certainly wouldn't lol!! I know games aren't meant to be realistic, but still....There is also a multiplayer mode available. Unlike other similar games which offers this, somehow Darkness 2 multiplayer mode feels absolutely tacked on and unnecessary and is quite possibly the worst multiplayer mode ever made. There is absolutely no story, no thought gone into it and absolutely no entertainment to be gotten from it.I've tried the multiplayer campaign with 4 friends and none of us knew what the heck we had to do except to just shoot everything that is not us. I would've rate the multiplayer mode 2/10 if it were a standalone product. Absolutely disgraceful addition and they should've just dropped it to make a better single player experience.In closing, it is a pity that Darkness 1 was never released on the PC, as im sure the whole game series would've felt much better when played back to back.Overall Rating: 7.0 / 10Actually, just for the story alone, its worth 7/10. Gameplay wise, its 5/10. Buy this game if you enjoy a heavily scripted FPS with a decent single player story. Not worth full price, but not a bad deal if on a cheap sale.

content:
Posted: November 3, 2016
												WARNING! MAJOR SPOILERS! DO NOT READ IF YOU WANT TO PLAY THE GAME YOURSELF! Still here? Okay, here we go!  This game was a total mindf*ck.  Throughout the story, you get these flashes of a mental hospital, and you're one of the patients.  All of the other characters in the game are either doctors or other patients in this hospital.  They tell you that the "Darkness" is just a dillusion, and they're trying to help you get better.  On the other side, in the gameplay you're told that this hospital is just a facade put up by the Darkness while it rebuilds your body after taking heavy damage.  The problem is, both sides of this can be equally correct, so you go through the whole game wondering which one is real.  At the climax, the game straight up asks you to choose a side.  And here we are, left with a great big Schrodinger's Cat situation.  You can play through both endings, and they both make sense in their context, but you're left wondering.  Did I defy the Darkness, chase it to hell, defeat it, and save my girl, or did I jump off a roof and kill myself, having one last delusion before hitting the ground?  Did I give up on my delusions and let the doctors help me live a normal life, or did I give in to the Darkness and let it keep me in a neverending dream?  Of course, the little post-credits bits left me with even more questions.  In the end, there is no absolute conclusion, and the player is left to sit there and debate over what they think is true.  This is one of the things that makes this game so amazing, and why I absolutely reccomend it to anyone.

												Ok, the game itself its quite good. It has an amazing story, especially for a more or less Mafia tale, the characters are all top notch, and all the lines are well preformed. The graphics look pretty good, with some bad textures from time to time, but its all cell shaded, which makes it look a lot like Borderlands. But that would only be if Borderlands was bloody. No joke, there was less gore in saving private Ryan. Limbs get torn off, people get impaled, and its all in this bloody mess. Which is good, by the way. Anyway, the gameplay is very arcade like shoot em up, with your demon arm to help impale people. Even on the lowest difficulty setting, its still a hard game, coming from a seasoned DkS2 vet,and well, ya. The only gripe I have with the gameplay is that ammo is semi-scare in early game, which well, just feels weird in an FPS.Overall, if you find the game on a sale, pick up up without hesitation. If you dont, well, here comes one of my only gripes. Single Player length. It will last only about 6 hours on Med. I get that its not that big of a deal, but well, for a game with not to much replay value...I mean, it does have a coop mode, but when I picked it up, the coop was dead.

Game is unplayable.Game is known for its terrible CTD issues which have yet to be resolved.Some are related to Zone Alarm AV others Anti-Aliasing.I'm amongst those with a killer rig but cannot progress beyond first 2 levels no matter what.CTD or stuck at purple ring loading screen beyond start of Stage 2.Some have said the game cannot handle 2650 resolution so be warned.From what little I have played it is actually quite fun.UPDATEManaged to find a workaround for the game. There are parts of the game where you play as a character that needs to move through tight spaces like a vent or under a boardwalk. VYSNC seems to cause issues where you get stuck and cannot progress in the game as its like having an invisible wall in front of you.Tinkering with VSYNC makes it work for some reason.

												Darkness 2 is a twisted and dark FPS with  a lot of blood, guts and ripped bodyparts. The story is dark too and tells us a story of a mafia boss struggling with his inner "darkness" which is trying to break free. I haven't read the comics or played the first one but didn't feel I missed anything. Mechanic-vise you got weapons to shoot through iron sight and two tentacle demon arms to smash enemies to pieces, grabbing and throwing stuff etc. I was surprised how nice it felt to use all the powers and to cause mayhem. Both shooting and the arms feel complementing each other and useful  together. Darkness 2 isn't a long game but since it's simply running through corridors killing enemies it started to get a bit stale towards the end... and then the game ended. There is newgame+ and some smaller campaigns but I didn't try those and neither I will. I'm happy what I got with the main game and will move towards a next game.

Posted: March 31, 2015
												This is a rail-shooter/FPS based on a Top Cow comic book series, in case you didn't already know.Follow Jackie Estocato, a New York mafioso who has risen through the ranks in the previous game, to be the boss he is now.Oh and he is demonically posessed, and on a quest into his own personal, and literal hell, for the soul of his girlfriend. Controller is probably the best way to play it, since remapping the keyboard isn't an option that's available for some keys, at least it wasn't for me, as I had broken those keys.It was a fun romp for the 6-8 hours you get out of it, and some ideas there in the later chapters give you some other ideas about Jackie, and leaves you wondering.7/10 - I personally didn't connect with Jackie, but that didn't stop me from having fun with this shoot-em-up. Would be nice if it were longer, or the multiplayer were better or just not included so that the main game could have that energy spent on it. And then there's the controversy over the field of view. I had to take off another point just for that.

content:
Posted: July 23, 2016
												Well this is disappointing, I had The Darkness II in my library since 2014 and thought it would be an amazing game. Oh boy, how wrong I was...Pro:+ Beautiful comic book art style. Of of the best besides Borderlands and The Wolf Among Us.+ Some levels look really good thanks to the art direction.+ A dual wielding system where you can mostly mix and match, meaning you can carry a Desert Eagle in one hand and an UMP 45 in the other one. Or two UMP's in both, two Desert Eagle's in both, etc. This is very welcoming since this is rarely seen in FPS games.+ Quite decent voice acting.+ The Vendettas (COOP levels) are quote fun, much more fun than the SP campaign even.Cons:- The story is worse than average, you won't find anything new or exciting here.- It took me only 6 hours to complete the main story. There's some extra stuff and a new game option, but it's nothing but unnecessary padding. To think that this game costs $30 is appalling.-  I mentioned "extra stuff", it's a tagged on COOP campaign. They're selling a Four Pack for $90 on this very Store Page and you'll be able to get 2 or 3 hours of gameplay with your friends, now if this isn't value for your money, right? /s- The gameplay feels just like your basic CoD clone. Hitmarkers? = ✓ Huge crosshair that forces you to use ADS? = ✓ Heavily scripted gameplay? = ✓ Cutscenes every few minutes? = ✓ 3 Weapon carry limit? = ✓ Regen health? = ✓ Jumping is useless because of invisible barriers? - ✓ Useless AI? = ✓ - The soundtrack is extremely boring, it's your typical Hollywood music that's supposed to sound "epic".- The darkness powers are meh at best, you can slice enemies in half or behead them, though you'll be seeing the same exact animation every time. I haven't counted them but there don't seem to be more than 4 or 5 different kill animations.- The game is almost entirely composed of corridors. I wasn't kidding when I compared this to CoD, hell, the few CoD games I played actually had more open areas than this game.- I've mentioned this before, the AI is beyond awful. Enemies will take cover right next to you. Enemies will yell "Don't get too close to him", while running towards you or standing right next to you. Some levels have  friendly NPC's to back yo up, but they don't actually do anything when an enemy gets close to them. The enemy will also fully ignore your pals, they're only fixated on you.- Talking about enemies, the entire game uses them same enemy models over and over again, just with a slightly different skin.- The enemies are extremely annoying to the point of madness. There are enemies who will blind you so that you can't see anything whatsoever for a few seconds, your darkness powers won't work then either, enemies who have huge shields to protect themselves, they'll shoot you from a distance and when they get close they'll knock you back a large distance, enemies who can literally throw a magical lasso at you that will steal the weapons your currently carrying, then there's the teleporting enemies which teleport themselves all over the map. All of these enemies are also huge bullet-sponges and you'll run out of ammo all the time because the game tries to force you to use your darkness powers.- The boss battles are like this: Huge bullet-sponges that can usually teleport and send waves of enemies at you.- Talking about waves of enemies, a lot of the SP campaign consist of you being locked in an arena type of level while enemies swarm all around you. You have to kill wave after wave and then the game allows you to move on. Rinse and repeat.- The graphics look better on the Store Page than they do in the game. I hate to be so negative about a game, especially a game with such a beautiful art style, but that's just the way it is.
